result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando Martinez-Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber privileges, good time and 973.03 community service

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fernando Martinez-Diaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission - Filed in 15-CF-66
DNA Proof of Submission - Filed in 15-CF-66

Defendant Fernando  Martinez-Diaz in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF66 & 15CF53  Interpreter Teresa Berger questioned by court.  Teresa Berger duly sworn on oath.  Agreement.  Amended complaint filed 15CF53  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  No contest plea entered to 4th degree sexual assault.  15CF66 Ct 1 - No contest plea  Ct 2 Amended by State to Misdemeanor Bail jumping.  Court amends.  No contest plea entered.  15CF53 State request 6 month jail imposed and stayed probation 2 yrs with conditions.  15CF66 Ct 1 state request 30 days jail with $100. fine.  and ct 2 - Impose 6 months jail stayed with 1 yr probation.  Victim rights have been complied with in 15CF53.  Atty Morgan agrees with the agreement.   Plea advisement form completed and reviewed.   Elements reviewed.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Court finds pleas entered freely and voluntarily.  Court finds def unders charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis.  Court accepts plea and found guilty 15CF53 and Ct 1 & ct 2 in 15CF66.  No additional sentencing arguments by State.  Nothing by Atty Morgan.  Brief statement by def.  Court will accept the joint recommendations of parties.  Court 15CF66 Ct 1 - 30 days jail.  $100.00 fine plus cost. Credit of 2 days.  Huber privileges and good time.  Bond applied.  973.03 community service.  Jail to commence today.  Atty Morgan requesting 30 days  to report.  No objection by State.  Court questions why def should not report today.  Statement by Atty Morgan.  Jail to commence 1-29-16 by 4:30 p.m  Ct 2 6month jail, stayed 1 yr probation.  Cost, to be taken from bond.  Balance of bond to poster.  Probation will concurrent with jail time 15CF53  6 months jail, stayed 2 yrs probations  Cost assessed.  Counseling as recommended by agent.  Cost to be taken from in this case  balance to poster.  DNA sample on each case  and surcharge  DNA colloquy.  Post conviction rights  Probation in 15CF53 will run concurrent with 15CF66  and jail time

ADDRESS INFO for Fernando Martinez-Diaz
Current: P.O. Box 96, Mattoon, WI 54450 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: 434 1/2 Dorr Street, Antigo, WI 54409 
(see 15-CF-53)

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Fernando Martinez-Diaz in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Teresa Berger duly sworn on oath.  Cases called 15CF53 and 15CF66. Court questions cousel in regards to timely preliminary.  Counsel has not talked to def.  Recess to discuss 1:35 pm.  Reconvene 1:41 pm.  Time limits for preliminary waived and preliminary hearings waived.  Court finds def voluntarily waives rights to preliminary hearings.   Court reviews right to preliminary Def waives right to preliminary.  Court will find probable cause.  Information to be filed.    State request 30 days to file informations.  Waiver applies to both cases.   Atty Morgan request that if informations mirror the complaint, entered plea now.  Informations will be filed later today and will follow the complaint.  Atty Morgan will waive reading of complaint & infomations and entered a not guilty plea to all counts.  Court will accept not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination
